newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal finmin denies report BNU sale planned.
newsitem.headline: Portugal finmin denies report BNU sale planned.

text.p: Portugal's Finance Ministry denied a report in Tuesday's Diario Economico paper which quoted a senior official as saying the government was preparing for a possible privatisation of Banco Nacional Ultramarino (BNU).
"Under-Secretary for the Budget Manuela Arcanjo clarifies that in terms of the privatisation programme for 1996/97, BNU will not be privatised," a statement said.

The paper had quoted Arcanjo as saying the Socialist government was preparing for a possible privatisation of BNU by transferring its pension fund to social security system Caixa Geral de Aposentacoes (CGA).

"It is not and it would never be the intention of the government to conduct the transfer of BNU's (pension) responsibilities to the CGA in order to contribute to a reduction in the (budget) deficit," the finance ministry said.
"The transfer of BNU's (pension) responsibilities to CGA aimed to contribute to the financial health of that institution (BNU)," it added.
